Text.Text: Greetings, brave traveler.  The way here has always been hard, but with the arrival of the duergar I'm certain the road was even more dangerous.  What's brought you here?
You're still here, I see.  I trust you've found the monastery hospitable during your stay.
What *are* these letters, Dolon?
But... is it true, Dolon?  *Why?*
I thought that you... you... *damn* you, Dolon!  And why do you even *have* those letters?  What could make a man so foolish as to not destroy them?
What are you saying?
But... I... I'll... do it.  I'll go, Dolon - I'll trust you.  We'll leave this world behind forever.

I don't know what to say, traveler - I can only ask your forgiveness, as Dolon asked for mine.  Leadership of the monastery falls to good Salisam, now - please make your request of him.  Farewell and good fortune.
How unfortunate - your journey has been in vain, traveler.  I can't allow you to descend beneath the monastery.  Speak to Sersa in the main quarters, if you'd care to rest before returning home...

The passage you speak of is no mere tunnel, traveler - it's the portal through which Valas, our founder, escaped his drow slavers and found the surface world.  It's part of his tomb, now, into which only the monks may enter.

They're best saved for others with more time, traveler.  I've many things to attend to as standing archimandrite of the monastery - no doubt you can find others less busy than I to answer your questions.
So those murderous slavers have taken to hiring mercenaries?  They're right to fear our wrath, as you'll soon learn...
Is there?  Thank you - I'll see to it that the matter's resolved.
Is he?  He's a good man, honorable, and an asset to the monastery.  But still... one moment, I'll have your claim looked into.
You may not.  The monastery is not currently accepting initiates, and will not be for some time.
Farewell and good fortune.
It seems you spoke truly, brave traveler.  Salisam and his conspirators have been exiled, banished from the monastery.  As for you... I will now allow you to face the Eight Chambers

The Eight Chambers make up a series of challenges designed to thwart those without the skill or willpower to be worthy of our order.  It will be difficult, but it can be done - every true monk here has succeeded.

When... if... you succeed, I will regard you as an associate of the monastery and allow you access to Valas' tomb and the Underdark passage within.   Morohem, on the second level of the monastery, will show you the Eight Chambers.
I hope that your facing the Eight Chambers goes well for you, brave traveler.

Congratulations, associate of the Black Raven Monastery - you now bear a distinction few indeed may boast of.  On the monastery's third level, you will now find the gate to Valas' tomb and the Underdark passage open to you.

Yes, I know of those letters... but the situation is more complicated than you know.  I've already sent another group to the Severed Hand, and intend to willingly face whatever punishment Ormis intends for me when he returns...

...what concerns me now, though, is how you must have gotten a hold of those letters.  Thieves are not tolerated in the Black Raven Monastery.  You may flee, now, or face the monastery's wrath and perish.
Truly?  Well, then - return them to where you found them and stay out of Dolons' chambers in the future.
I'd be a fool to trust a thief.  Flee or fight, those are your choices - I'll hear nothing else from you.
Very well.
Very well.
Don't be so foolish.  Only monks of the Order of the Black Raven are allowed to see Valas' Tomb.
Barud Barzam sent me to kill all of you.
I'm here in the hopes of using the Underdark passage beneath the monastery.
I found these letters in Dolon's chambers.
I found these letters in Dolon's chambers.
There's a thief here, disguised as a monk.
I have some questions.
Farewell, then.
They speak of a plot to disrupt the monastery's activities in the archimandrite's absence by turning you against him.
Farewell, Aruma.
Why can't I use the Underdark passage?
I found these letters in Dolon's chambers.
I found these letters in Dolon's chambers.
There's a thief here, disguised as a monk.
Farewell, then.
But... I *am* a monk.
Then may I become a monk?
I found these letters in Dolon's chambers.
I found these letters in Dolon's chambers.
Salisam is trying to have you removed from power.
There's a thief here, disguised as a monk.
I have some questions.

Farewell, then.
Farewell, Aruma.
Wait - the "Eight Chambers?"
Go on...
Go on, then...

My thanks.  Farewell.
